sen.j: 稲葉 正親（いなば まさちか、元禄5年（1692年） - 享保19年9月14日 (旧暦)（1734年10月10日））は、山城国淀藩の第4代藩主。
sen.e: Masachika INABA (1692-October 10, 1734) was the fourth feudal lord of the Yodo domain of the Province of Yamashiro.
Masachika INABA (1692 - October 10, 1734) was the fourth feudal lord of the Yodo Domain of the Province of Yamashiro.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。Domain大文字にしました。
sen.e: Masachika INABA (1692 - October 10, 1734) was the fourth feudal lord of the Yodo Domain of the Province of Yamashiro.
The eighth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.
The eighth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.
The eighth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.

sen.j: 大田原晴川（大田原政清の六男）の次男。
sen.e: The second son of Harukawa OTAWA (who was the sixth son of Masakiyo OTAWARA).
The second son of Harukawa OTAWARA (who was the sixth son of Masakiyo OTAWARA).
The second son of Harukawa OTAWARA (who was the sixth son of Masakiyo OTAWARA).

sen.j: 正室は柴田某の娘（稲葉正直の養女）。
sen.e: The lawful wife was the daughter of Soregashi SHIBATA (the adopted daughter of Masanao INABA).
The lawful wife was the daughter of so-and-so SHIBATA (the adopted daughter of Masanao INABA).
The lawful wife was the daughter of so-and-so SHIBATA (the adopted daughter of Masanao INABA).

sen.j: 子に稲葉正益（長男）、稲葉正福（次男）、稲葉正明（三男）、稲葉正名（四男）、稲葉正春（五男）。
sen.e: His children were: Masayoshi INABA (the first son), Masatomi INABA (the second son), Masaakira INABA (the third son), Masana INABA (the fourth son), Masaharu INABA (the fifth son).
His children were: Masayoshi INABA (the first son), Masatomi INABA (the second son), Masaakira INABA (the third son), Masana INABA (the fourth son), Masaharu INABA (the fifth son).
His children were: Masayoshi INABA (the first son), Masatomi INABA (the second son), Masaakira INABA (the third son), Masana INABA (the fourth son), Masaharu INABA (the fifth son).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、従四位下、越中国守、佐渡国守。
sen.e: His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).
sen.cmt: 「越中国守」は用語集にはEcchu-kokushu (the Lord of Ecchu Province)とありましたが、「佐渡国守」の訳語と表現を合わせて修正しました。
sen.e: His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).

His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).

sen.j: 元禄5年（1692年）、大田原で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1692 in Otawara.
He was born in 1692 in Otawara.
He was born in 1692 in Otawara.

sen.j: 淀藩の初代藩主・稲葉正知の叔父に当たる正直の養嗣子となった。
sen.e: He became the adopted heir of Masanao INABA, who was the uncle of Masatomo INABA, the first feudal lord of the Yodo domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became the adopted heir of Masanao INABA, who was the uncle of Masatomo INABA, the first feudal lord of the Yodo Domain.
He became the adopted heir of Masanao INABA, who was the uncle of Masatomo INABA, the first feudal lord of the Yodo Domain.

sen.j: その家督と2000石の所領を継いでいた。
sen.e: He took over as the head of the family and the shoryo (territory) of 2,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He took over as the head of the family and the shoryo (territory) of 2,000 koku.
He took over as the head of the family and the shoryo (territory) of 2,000 koku.

sen.j: この間に御使番・火事場見廻・御小姓組番頭などに就任している。
sen.e: During this period, he assumed the positions of Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield), Kajiba mimawari (person in charge of surveying scene of a fire) and the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun.

During this period, he assumed the positions of Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield), Kajiba mimawari (person in charge of surveying scene of a fire) and the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun.

During this period, he assumed the positions of Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield), Kajiba mimawari (person in charge of surveying scene of a fire) and the chief of the bodyguard of the Shogun.

sen.j: 享保15年（1730年）に本家の先代藩主・稲葉正恒が早世したため、その後を継いだ。
sen.e: In 1730, Masatsune INABA, the former feudal lord of the domain in the head family died young, and Masachika took over as the head of the family.
In 1730, Masatsune INABA, the former feudal lord of the domain in the head family died young, and Masachika took over as the head of the family.
In 1730, Masatsune INABA, the former feudal lord of the domain in the head family died young, and Masachika took over as the head of the family.

sen.j: そして奏者番、大坂城代を歴任している。
sen.e: He successively worked in different positions including sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle).
He successively worked in different positions including sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle).
He successively worked in different positions including sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle).

sen.j: 享保19年（1734年）9月14日、大坂で死去した。
sen.e: He died on September 14, 1734 (old lunar calendar) in Osaka.
He died on October 10, 1734 in Osaka.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。(old lunar calender) 削除しました。
sen.e: He died on October 10, 1734 in Osaka.
Died at the age of 43.
Died at the age of 43.
Died at the age of 43.

sen.j: 後を長男の正益が継いだ。
sen.e: His eldest son Masayoshi took over as the family head.
His oldest son Masayoshi took over as the family head.
His oldest son Masayoshi took over as the family head.
The posthumous Buddhist name: 大義院
The posthumous Buddhist name: Taigiin
sen.cmt: 大義院→読み方不明 Taigiinと推測して表記しました。
sen.e: The posthumous Buddhist name: Taigiin

sen.j: 墓所：京都市右京区花園の妙心寺麟祥院。
sen.e: Grave: At the Rinsho-in subtemple of Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Grave: At the Rinsho-in subtemple of Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Grave: At the Rinsho-in subtemple of Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
